column5: On your way to Ear Falls, Dutchie's on 105 in Perrault Falls sells various Canadian beers and liquor.
Pretty much any cold Canadian beer the first evening on PU tailgate taste fantastic OV Kokanee sp LaBlatt

I tried a bottle of it for the 1st time last week. It was too light/crisp/fizzy? for my taste. I like an amber or dark beer. The lodge had Molson Canadian and LOTW Sultana Gold on tap, and the LOTW barrel needed to be changed twice that week. It wasn't all me, but I did give it my all.
I tried Kokanee on the recommendation of the last beer thread. It's a good Beer. If you haven't tried Yengling lager, made in Pottsville, Pa, Americas oldest brewery, you should give it a try.

Yuenling Beer is very enjoyable. Happy that this brand is now available in Indiana so buying some for the August trip to Ear Falls won't be an issue. Would like to try some of the Canadian Beers, but the liquor stores are closed when we the back to the cabin each evening.Sadly our resortt does not have a bar.

Have not been to Canada (Ear Falls, Ontario) in a few years and was wondering if you can now buy beer in grocery stores now or what. Also, I like to bring back some local craft beers (IPAs) back for a few friends. Any suggestions of what to get?
Molsons. For a mere $43.95 US you get 24 cans with a free Canadian flag. It's a steal.........
If you have the time stop in at Lake of the Woods Brewing Co in Kenora. You can buy growlers there to take home. www.lowbrewco.com
Kokoanne and OV while I'm in Canada Sent from my iPhone using Tapatalk
Sleeman's Carling Alexander Keith's IPA 3 more long, agonizing weeks before I enjoy each one!!!
Almost forgot- you have to try some Arrowhead beer. It's a classic. Check it outhttps://m.youtube.com/watch?v=UiBv-O6GDn0
Ear falls has a liquor store by the grocery store on the west side of 105. Turn left on Spruce St. go 1 block in Plaza. Beer not available in the 2 grocery stores in Ear Falls

LCBO employees are possibly going on strike tonight at midnight! In smaller communities like Vermilion Bay & Ear Falls they also sell beer because there are no Brewers Retail stores in town.If the strike happens everyone will be out of luck for beer & spirits. I'm heading to the LCBO in Vermilion Bay this afternoon to stock up just in case.
We always bring back 2 cases of Sleeman's.
